ngoList.title: The North India Cerebral Palsy Association
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Ashirwad (The North India Cerebral Palsy Association) is a rehabilitation center cum school for cerebral palsy affected children. It is the only institution of its kind, catering to the need to Spastic Children in whole of north India, beyond Delhi. The center is having over 500 children registered with it, who are being looked after by specialized staff such as Occupational Therapist, Speech Therapist, Physiotherapist, and Special Educator Etc. To provide all these services under one roof.Children of Ashirwad are getting these services regularly. Provision of orthotic aids and appliance. Parent training and home based program for children from out-station Awareness arising workshop for parents teachers and doctors. Goal To achieve full inclusion of person with Disabilities into Main Steam Objectives 1) To work for the rehabilitation  physical, education, vocational, ADL training to children with disabilities and multiple disabilities. a) To provide intensive early intervention services  to minimize the erect of disabilities and to prevent secondary disabilities. b) To provide a special education services  to children who cannot cope up with normal education system. c) To provide pre-vocational and vocational guidance and training to prepare young adults with disabilities to adopt some vocation. 2) For the betterment of Society  a) To make accessibility a possibility  removal of all physical barriers. b) Promoting inclusive education in normal school. c) Making parents and families aware about concessions and benefits available for their child with disabilities. d) To help and support parents and families to overcome stress of rearing a child with disabilities. e) To spread rehabilitation services for children with disabilities in rural areas and slums. f) Advocacy g) Breaking Barriers District Level Republic Day function was celebrated at Govt. College for Boys. the NGO working for disability sector- Ashirwad, took part in the cultural programme to showcase the abilities of person with disabilities. Ashirwad has provided this opportunity first time to children with disabilities to participate in the official District Level Republic Day function.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Every year United Sikh Mission volunteers help fund raise in effort to provide free eye care. United Sikh Mission journey of service to humanity started in the year of 2005 with one medical camp. Over the decade we have grown significantly in our effort to serve humanity without any discrimination. From 2005 to April of 2018, United Sikh Mission has organized 314 eye operations and check-up camps in India facilitating the needy people with free eye operations, free medications, free spectacles.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Currently, UNITED SIKHS is providing mortuary van and ambulance services, oxygen cylinders, concentrators to the needy and Bipaps to the hospitals, in Delhi, Punjab, Haryana and Karnataka. We served in during last Lock down period to the labor class and the other needy, by providing them cooked meals and groceries. We recently served in Floods in Punjab, Assam, Kerala, Karnataka, and in Odisha during cyclone. We also sponsor school and professional fees of the needy students.
